thread.title: Prep roundup: UEC River tennis tourney set
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: UEC River tennis tourney set

title: Prep roundup: UEC River tennis tourney set
text:
Prep roundup: UEC River tennis tourney set Published: Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 10:43 p.m. CDT By KANE COUNTY CHRONICLE 
ST. CHARLES â€“ Geneva leads the seven team field with 34 points entering today's opening rounds of the Upstate Eight Conference River Division girls tennis tournament. 
The competition, which concludes Saturday, will be split between singles play at St. Charles East and doubles play at St. Charles North. The North Stars are in second place with 30 points collected during duals season. 
Geneva's Grace Kruger boasts the top seed at No. 1 singles, while North's tandem of Morgan Rerko and Emma Spellman has that distinction at No. 1 doubles. 
GIRLS SWIMMING 
St. Charles East 97, Elgin 65: At St. Charles, East cruised on its senior night. 
GIRLS VOLLEYBALL 
DeKalb def. Kaneland, 2-0 (25-20, 25-17): At Maple Park, Kaneland was swept in Northern Illinois Big 12 East play. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Kaneland 3, Morris 0: At Morris, Angel Escontrias, Drew Franklin and Andres Tovar scored goals for Kaneland (8-5-4, 4-1-2 NI Big 12 East), which has won seven of its past 10. 
Geneva 5, DeKalb 0: At Geneva, Matt Waldoch scored twice for 4-5-6 Geneva. 
Marmion 4, St. Rita 0: At Chicago, Nick Grant had a hat trick for Marmion. 
Marengo 2, Burlington Central 1: At Marengo, Jack Schramme scored the lone goal for Burlington Central (9-9-1, 8-4 BNC East) in the Big Northern Conference loss.
